title: Patrick Noubissié
text:
Patrick Benjamin Noubissié Youmbi (born 25 June 1983) is a retired <a href="France">French</a> professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and <a href="Physical%20therapy">physiotherapist</a>.
Playing career.
Noubissie has played for French sides <a href="CS%20Sedan%20Ardennes">CS Sedan Ardennes</a> and US Roye Foot Picardie 80 before signing for <a href="The%20Football%20Association">English</a> teams <a href="Crewe%20Alexandra%20F.C.">Crewe Alexandra</a> and <a href="Swindon%20Town%20F.C.">Swindon Town</a>.
In August 2007, Noubissie signed a two-year contract with <a href="Hibernian%20F.C.">Hibernian</a>. Noubissie was then immediately loaned to <a href="Livingston%20F.C.">Livingston</a> for three months to build up his match fitness. He returned to <a href="Easter%20Road">Easter Road</a> in November 2007 and made a few appearances for Hibs, but he then fell out of favour after <a href="manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> <a href="John%20Collins%20%28footballer%20born%201968%29">John Collins</a> resigned.
Noubissie was subsequently loaned out to <a href="Dundee%20F.C.">Dundee</a> on 4 March 2008 as an emergency loan. At the end of the season, Noubissie was <a href="Free%20transfer%20%28football%29">released</a> by Hibs.
In July 2009, he trained and played in pre-season friendlies for English <a href="Conference%20National">Conference National</a> side <a href="Kettering%20Town%20F.C.">Kettering Town</a>, with the club's manager <a href="Mark%20Cooper%20%28footballer%20born%201968%29">Mark Cooper</a> aiming to agree a deal for the midfielder.
In August 2009, he joined Kettering after gaining international clearance from the Cypriot FA. and made his debut in the 1–1 draw against local rivals <a href="Oxford%20United">Oxford United</a>
Physiotherapy career.
Due to a long-standing hip injury and multiple surgeries, Patrick was forced to retire from football aged 28 while playing for Kettering Town in the conference at the end of the season 2011/2012.
He trained as a <a href="Physical%20therapy">physiotherapist</a> at <a href="Coventry%20University">Coventry University</a> where he graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in physiotherapy and Master of Science degree in Manual Therapy.
Patrick Firstly took a position as assistant First team physiotherapist at <a href="Northamptonshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Northamptonshire County Cricket Club</a> assisting Barry Goudriaan, the Head of Sports and Exercise Medicine.
He then moved on to join <a href="Leicester%20City%20Football%20Club">Leicester City Football Club</a> as an Academy Physiotherapist.
On 1 September 2018, with the appointment of Dutch duo <a href="Clarence%20Seedorf">Clarence Seedorf</a> and <a href="Patrick%20Kluivert">Patrick Kluivert</a> respectively named Cameroon National Team Head coach and assistant coach, Patrick was appointed as Cameroon National team Physiotherapist.
